segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: We've got some great releases this week, with Remotion 4 and Expo SDK 49 in beta. Next.js devs are working on DX optimizations. The articles on React + SVG and VisionCamera are super interesting.

segments.content: Remotion lets you create videos with React. This week, it's [Remotion v4 launch week](https://www.remotion.dev/4), kicked off by a [Keynote](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S3C9wlPNhkQ) that demonstrates well the renderer's new 3D SVG capabilities. Announcements are scheduled each day to present the new features, which are also detailed in the blog post. Here are a few highlights:
segments.sourceMdx: Remotion lets you create videos with React. This week, it's [Remotion v4 launch week](https://www.remotion.dev/4), kicked off by a [Keynote](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S3C9wlPNhkQ) that demonstrates well the renderer's new 3D SVG capabilities. Announcements are scheduled each day to present the new features, which are also detailed in the blog post. Here are a few highlights:

segments.content:
* Remotion Studio: Zod-based visual props editing, render button...
* Rust-powered architecture, FFmpeg baked in, 2x faster OffthreadVideo
* SVG 3D engine
* Tailwind, Rive integration
segments.sourceMdx:
- Remotion Studio: Zod-based visual props editing, render button...
- Rust-powered architecture, FFmpeg baked in, 2x faster OffthreadVideo
- SVG 3D engine
- Tailwind, Rive integration

segments.content: There's also a [launch on ProductHunt](https://www.producthunt.com/posts/remotion-4-0) today so don't hesitate to vote ;)

segments.content: [![RBreaking Up with SVG-in-JS in 2023](/emails/issues/151/svginjs.jpg)](https://kurtextrem.de/posts/svg-in-js)
segments.sourceMdx: [![RBreaking Up with SVG-in-JS in 2023](/emails/issues/151/svginjs.jpg)](https://kurtextrem.de/posts/svg-in-js)

segments.content: **[Breaking Up with SVG-in-JS in 2023](https://kurtextrem.de/posts/svg-in-js)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Breaking Up with SVG-in-JS in 2023](https://kurtextrem.de/posts/svg-in-js)**

segments.content:
Very comprehensive article on the various ways of using SVGs in a React app, and their impact on performance.
Advises against "SVG-in-JS": you should avoid rendering SVG markup via React components and having the SVG code be present in the JS bundle, including via solutions such as the SVGR loader. With a few exceptions, it's best to avoid inlining SVGs in HTML: React Server Components aren't necessarily an ideal solution either. SVG sprites are a good solution.
segments.sourceMdx:
Very comprehensive article on the various ways of using SVGs in a React app, and their impact on performance.
Advises against "SVG-in-JS": you should avoid rendering SVG markup via React components and having the SVG code be present in the JS bundle, including via solutions such as the SVGR loader. With a few exceptions, it's best to avoid inlining SVGs in HTML: React Server Components aren't necessarily an ideal solution either. SVG sprites are a good solution.

segments.content:
* ğŸ‘€ [React.dev PR - Adds a TypeScript overview page](https://github.com/reactjs/react.dev/pull/6120): a doc page is coming soon to document the use of React APIs with TypeScript.
* ğŸ‘€ [Next.js - Improving next/image support](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1674250190432116736)
* ğŸ“œ [Form validation with Conform, Zod, and Remix](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-conform): Conform is a library that validates FormData on the server, respects Remix's progressive enhancement and displays errors on the client. I think we should be able to [use it with Next.js Server Actions](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1676210400256204800) later?
* ğŸ“œ [Declaring JSX types in TypeScript 5.1](https://blog.logrocket.com/declaring-jsx-types-typescript-5-1/): explains the recent improvements to JSX typing, particularly for React.
* ğŸ“œ [React Hook for Avoiding Flash of Empty UI While Data Transitions](https://www.jameskerr.blog/posts/use-data-transition/)
* ğŸ“œ [Storybook - In-app tour for new users](https://storybook.js.org/blog/in-app-tour-for-new-users/)

See Tim Neutkens' [comment](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/48748#issuecomment-1614456247) for more details.
* ğŸ“¦ [Styled-Components v6](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/releases/tag/v6.0.0): some breaking changes well documented in an upgrade guide..

segments.content: [![React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing for Next.js, Remix and Gatsby.](/emails/issues/148/reactbricks.png)](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)
segments.sourceMdx: [![React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing for Next.js, Remix and Gatsby.](/emails/issues/148/reactbricks.png)](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)

segments.content: **[React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing for Next.js, Remix and Gatsby.](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing for Next.js, Remix and Gatsby.](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)**

segments.content: **It's flexible for Developers**: with React components you can create your own design system. Add true inline Visual editing to your JSX and add sidebar controls to edit props like the background color. You can choose Next.js, Remix or Gatsby and any CSS framework!
segments.sourceMdx: **It's flexible for Developers**: with React components you can create your own design system. Add true inline Visual editing to your JSX and add sidebar controls to edit props like the background color. You can choose Next.js, Remix or Gatsby and any CSS framework!

segments.content: **Content editors**Â can easily edit content inline without breaking the design system. It's as easy as using Word or Pages, allowing them to create landing pages in minutes without relying on developer resources.
segments.sourceMdx: **Content editors**Â can easily edit content inline without breaking the design system. It's as easy as using Word or Pages, allowing them to create landing pages in minutes without relying on developer resources.

segments.content: **It's enterprise-ready**Â with Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, GDPR-compliant datacenters, Global CDN for optimized images, E-commerce integration, Fine-grained permissions, Scheduled publishing and more.
segments.sourceMdx: **It's enterprise-ready**Â with Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, GDPR-compliant datacenters, Global CDN for optimized images, E-commerce integration, Fine-grained permissions, Scheduled publishing and more.

segments.content: The new 49 SDK has just been released, in beta for around a week. A release packed with lots of great improvements, it's difficult to list them all. Here are my highlights:
segments.sourceMdx: The new 49 SDK has just been released, in beta for around a week. A release packed with lots of great improvements, it's difficult to list them all. Here are my highlights:

segments.content:
* React-Native v0.72
* Expo Router v2 RC
* Reanimated v3
* Network debugging, VS Code debugging
* React devtools built-in
* Environment variables
* Local Expo Modules
* Experimental support for Fabric in expo-dev-client

segments.content: [![Reinventing Camera Processing - TensorFlow Lite GPU straight from JavaScript](/emails/issues/151/visioncamera.jpg)](https://mrousavy.com/blog/Reinventing-Camera-Processing)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Reinventing Camera Processing - TensorFlow Lite GPU straight from JavaScript](/emails/issues/151/visioncamera.jpg)](https://mrousavy.com/blog/Reinventing-Camera-Processing)

segments.content: **[Reinventing Camera Processing - TensorFlow Lite GPU straight from JavaScript](https://mrousavy.com/blog/Reinventing-Camera-Processing)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Reinventing Camera Processing - TensorFlow Lite GPU straight from JavaScript](https://mrousavy.com/blog/Reinventing-Camera-Processing)**

segments.content: Marc Rousavy explains how he is able to run TensorFlow models on React-Native Vision Camera v3 ([demo](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1674791891823648770)). His plugin has just been open-sourced in [VisionCamera v3 rc.3](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1675883155822202880). The article is fairly technical, explaining how it works internally to run at 60+ FPS. TLDR: it's now very easy to integrate a TensorFlow model into Vision Camera, and draw some real-time feedback via React-Native-Skia. There's no need to write native code, and all this logic can even be deployed via Over-The-Air updates!
segments.sourceMdx: Marc Rousavy explains how he is able to run TensorFlow models on React-Native Vision Camera v3 ([demo](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1674791891823648770)). His plugin has just been open-sourced in [VisionCamera v3 rc.3](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1675883155822202880). The article is fairly technical, explaining how it works internally to run at 60+ FPS. TLDR: it's now very easy to integrate a TensorFlow model into Vision Camera, and draw some real-time feedback via React-Native-Skia. There's no need to write native code, and all this logic can even be deployed via Over-The-Air updates!

segments.content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

segments.content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is \~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe\_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
